articles.title: This day that year: Deepti-Punam create Women's ODI history, Don Bradman hits quickfire hundred - India Today
articles.description: On this day in cricket history: India openers Deepti Sharma and Punam Raut stiched 320 for the opening wicket against Ireland to set a new world record in women's ODI cricket.
articles.content:
On May 15, 2017, Deepti Sharma and Poonam Raut set the record for the highest partnership in women's ODIs when they posted 320 for the opening stand in an ODI against Ireland in Potchefstroom, South Africa.
Deepti Sharma made 188 from 160 balls, hitting 27 b… [+1485 chars]

articles.title: People say Dhoni never loses cool but I’ve seen it couple of times: Gautam Gambhir - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Gautam Gambhir, who has shared the dressing room with Dhoni for years, revealed a couple of instances during the 2007 T20 World Cup and in the IPL when Dhoni lost his cool.
articles.content: His cool and calm presence behind the stumps has been a constant for Team India over the past decade and half. Dhoni’s assured presence as a leader of men, even after giving up captaincy, has been a comforting factor for the bowlers over the years. A calculat… [+1610 chars]

articles.description: India's head coach reckons cricket boards should put the emphasis on domestic tournaments and bilateral series once normal service resumes
articles.content:
"Instead of 15 teams flying in, we'd settle for one team flying in and playing an entire bilateral series at one or two grounds," says Shastri. © Getty

articles.description: Fast bowler Kyle Jamieson, spinner Ajaz Patel and batsman Devon Conway have been awarded a New Zealand Cricket (NZC) contract for the first time.

articles.title: ‘The best way to use MS will be to…’ Former player on how India can get the maximum out of Dhoni - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Prasad reckons that at 38 and with slowing reflexes, India can benefit the most from Dhoni if he is made to bat higher.
articles.content: Former India fast bowler Venkatesh Prasad feels MS Dhoni is better suited to play up the order than as a finisher. The former India captain, who has not played since the World Cup, has enjoyed good numbers batting at No. 3 and 4, scoring 2351 runs from 46 com… [+1653 chars]

articles.title: ‘I’m your captain, don’t try to fool me’: When an angry Dhoni scolded Shami - The Indian Express
articles.description: Mohammed Shami, who made his debut under MS Dhoni, says the usually calm captain once told him off in strict words: "I have seen many players come and go, don't lie to me."
articles.content: MS Dhoni gave Mohammed Shami a strict talking-to on a tour of New Zealand in 2014, Shami revealed. (Screengrab)Mohammed Shami revealed that MS Dhoni had rebuked him in strong words on a tour of New Zealand in 2014, when the pacer had bowled a bouncer in frust… [+1991 chars]
